humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The sound of " meat " and " chen " in Xiaozhuan often express the lips, that is, the muscle tissue surrounding the mouth of a person or animal. Bronze inscriptions have a " lip " from the sound of " moon " and " chen ", which means morning, and has the same meaning as the word " su " (the original meaning is early). Duo Youding: "The Lips of Jiashen (Morning)". Inscriptions from the " month of" " lip " and Xiaozhuan from " meat " of " lip suspected homoglyph the scribe."

" Lip " often refers to the lip, the muscle tissue surrounding the mouth of a human or animal. "Shuowen": "The mouth is also from the flesh, the sound of the hour. The ancient lip is from the page." "Zhuangzi‧ Pirates": "The lips are like intense pill, and the teeth are like qibei." Han silk book " Lip " also said Lips, "Mawangdui. "Held Yin and Yang": "Nasal sweat, white lips, hands and feet."

" Lip " also means the side or edge of the object. "Mozi‧ Preparing Acupoints": "Difficult acupoints, take the lip shingles of the pool outside the city and loosen them, cut the acupoints from the outside to reach the spring."
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The sound of " meat " and " chen " in Xiaozhuan often express the lips, that is, the muscle tissue surrounding the mouth of humans or animals.
humanum_full_description:
小篆從「肉」，「辰」聲，常表示嘴唇，即人或動物口的周圍的肌肉組織。金文有從「月」，「辰」聲的「脣」，表示早晨，與「夙」字（本義是早）意同。多友鼎：「甲申之脣（晨）」。金文從「月」的「脣」與小篆從「肉」的「脣」疑為隸定後的同形字。

　　「脣」常表示嘴唇，即人或動物口的周圍的肌肉組織。《說文》：「口耑也。从肉，辰聲。䫃，古文脣从頁。」《莊子‧盜跖》：「脣如激丹，齒如齊貝。」 漢帛書「脣」也表示嘴唇，《馬王堆．合陰陽》：「鼻汗脣白，手足皆作。」

　　「脣」也表示稱物的邊或邊緣。《墨子‧備穴》：「難穴，取城外池脣木瓦散之，外斬其穴，深到泉。」
humanum_short_description: 小篆從「肉」，「辰」聲，常表示嘴唇，即人或動物口的周圍的肌肉組織。

小篆從「 肉 」，「 辰 」聲，常表示嘴唇，即人或動物口的周圍的肌肉組織。金文有從「 月 」，「 辰 」聲的「 脣 」，表示早晨，與「 夙 」字（本義是早）意同。多友鼎：「甲申之脣（晨）」。金文從「 月 」的「 脣 」與小篆從「 肉 」的「 脣 」疑為隸定後的同形字。 「 脣 」常表示嘴唇，即人或動物口的周圍的肌肉組織。《說文》：「口耑也。从肉，辰聲。䫃，古文脣从頁。」《莊子‧盜跖》：「脣如激丹，齒如齊貝。」 漢帛書「 脣 」也表示嘴唇，《馬王堆．合陰陽》：「鼻汗脣白，手足皆作。」 「 脣 」也表示稱物的邊或邊緣。《墨子‧備穴》：「難穴，取城外池脣木瓦散之，外斬其穴，深到泉。」
Elaboration: The sound of " meat" and " chen" in Xiaozhuan often express the lips, that is, the muscle tissue surrounding the mouth of a person or animal. Bronze inscriptions have a " lip" from the sound of " moon" and " chen", which means morning, and has the same meaning as the word " su" (the original meaning is early). Duo Youding: "The Lips of Jiashen (Morning)". Inscriptions from the " month of" " lip" and Xiaozhuan from " meat" of " lip suspected homoglyph the scribe." " Lip" often refers to the lip, the muscle tissue surrounding the mouth of a human or animal. "Shuowen": "The mouth is also from the flesh, the sound of the hour. The ancient lip is from the page." "Zhuangzi‧ Pirates": "The lips are like intense pill, and the teeth are like qibei." Han silk book " Lip" also said Lips, "Mawangdui. "Held Yin and Yang": "Nasal sweat, white lips, hands and feet." " Lip" also means the side or edge of the object. "Mozi‧ Preparing Acupoints": "Difficult acupoints, take the lip shingles of the pool outside the city and loosen them, cut the acupoints from the outside to reach the spring."

脣字的基本解释

脣
chún
同“唇”。

脣字的汉语字典释义

[①]［chún］
［《廣韻》食倫切，平諄，船。］
“唇1”的被通假字。“唇1”的古字。
(1)嘴唇。
(2)借称物的边或边缘。

脣字的康熙字典解释

【未集下】【肉字部】　脣； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页983第23
〔古文〕䫃【唐韻】食倫切【韻會】船倫切【正韻】殊倫切，?音漘。【說文】口耑也。【玉篇】口脣也。【釋名】脣，緣也，口之緣也。【春秋·元命包】脣者，齒之垣。【穀梁傳·僖三年】語曰：脣亡則齒寒。　又牛脣，草名。【爾雅·釋草】蕒，牛脣。【註】水蕮也。　又【類篇】彌盡切，音泯。䐇合無波際貌。　【集韻】或作䐇脗。【韻會】亦書作脤。脗原字从豕，不从勿作。

脣字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
脣字的起名意思

暂无。

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Not set next] [Department of meat characters] 　lip; Kangxi strokes: 13; page number: page 983 to 23
〔古文〕䫃【Tang Yun】Shi Lunqi [Rhyme Club] Boat Lunqi 【Zheng Yun】Special Lunqi,? Yin Chu. [Said the text] The mouth is also. [Jade articles] The lips are also. [Release name] Lips have a margin, and a mouth has a margin. [Chunqiu·Yuanmingbao] The lips are the walls of the teeth. [Guliang Chuan·Xi Three Years] Saying: If the lips are dead, the teeth are cold.　Bull lips, cursive name. 【Erya·Shuicao】Mian, cow lips. [Note] Water lotus also.　[Category Chapter] It’s all over, the sound is muted. There is no wave-like appearance.　【Jiyun】Or as a quagmire. [Rhyme Club] It is also written in a book. The original word for 脗 is from hog, not from hog.
